dialogues.text: I'm not asking you, Kate. I'm telling you: you should come home with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks up, genuinely turned-on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUE MUSIC: "SEXYBACK" by Justin Timberlake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal and Kate BARGE in, passionately kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping for breath) This is my dumpy apartment that I had to move into when I left my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love that you're being so honest. It's so different, so hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been with a woman besides my ex-wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More, tell me more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried you have AIDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes him down on the couch, takes her sweater off. She's wearing just a bra. She looks amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show you off to my wife to make her jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She GROWLS and dives on top of him as we launch:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The next morning a DISHEVELED CAL lets Kate out, gives her a big passionate kiss, and closes the DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We STAY ON the DOOR. After a beat, it opens up: as Cal bids farewell to a NEW GIRL on a new morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal strides in -- a skip in his step, a perfectly tailored suit on his body. Everything's in SLOW MOTION. He points at someone, winks at a waitress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SAD SACK GUY at the bar watches Cal stride by, jealous. Cal Weaver has evolved into "the fucking man."  58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) HANNAH studies late into the night for the bar. 2) JESSICA reads magazine articles on "How to Make Him Notice You." 3) TRACY eats ice cream in bed, alone. 4) ROBBIE drags mysterious wood planks into his backyard. But we're mainly with CAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEW WOMAN EXITS. The door closes. It re-opens as he  kisses goodbye ANOTHER WOMAN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are mid-conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it would work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do college guys hate? Doing  laundry. What do they love?  Strippers. It's a strip club  where they can do their laundry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yours isn't? A candy store  that only sells red candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone loves the cherry. Look,  I'm not rejecting the psuedo-  cherry flavors like raspberry or  strawberry, anything in the -erry  family is allowed. But let's be  real here: no one wants the  lemon. No one likes the grape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like grape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then you can't come to my  store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH, quickly becoming inseparable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A late 40s couple eat dinner: BERNIE (the big guy who  "broke up" with Cal earlier) and CLAIRE, a bubbly little  woman -- the polar opposite of her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I almost forgot -- heard some good gossip at the nail salon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the poor bastard alone, would you? I gave him the cologne  like you told me to. We don't  have to dance on his grave.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What did you hear about Mr. Weaver, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently, Mr. Weaver has become quite a man-about-town if you get my drift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of young women coming in and  out of his apartment lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, would you cut it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good for Jess to know. She still baby-sits for him after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon! Enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's good gossip at the least. Ooh, guess what else I heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she CONTINUES CHATTERING in the b.g., we HOLD ON Jessica. Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica waits at her LOCKER. She spots a TALL BLONDE GIRL moving down the hallway, texting as she walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madison! Madison, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madison stops walking, but not texting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I had a question --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madison holds up a finger ("one second") and continues texting. Finally, she stops. Looks up. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jessica, whassup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a question for you, Madison. It's kind of on the personal side so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lips are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madison extends her arms, begins clapping and making WEIRD NOISES. Jessica stares at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lips are seals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. So, Madison, here's the thing... I don't mean to be blunt or insulting but, let's call it what it is: you're always sleeping with older guys, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of college guys, I've heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even rumors about a few teachers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So my question is: how do you do that? I mean, how do you get them not to see you as... well, a kid in high school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well first off, I have a huge  rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that helps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm sure it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a huge rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't unfortunately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's not gonna work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madison SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's what you do. Wait, how old is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like really old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like parent old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nasty. Rock on, Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Madison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, you have to hook him. Force his hand. Make him unable to stop himself from doing what he knows to be wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what I do. Send him a postcard  from downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go TMZ on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not following you, Madis--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The full gyno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Jessica's blank look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crotch shot? A nip slip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dirty picture! You can even  Annie Leibowitz it. Tasteful but  with nipple. Yeah, that's what  you should do: make it artistic.  Black and white. Make this face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes a raw sexual face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Madison!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you came to me for advice, that's my advice. You put those across his radar, he won't see you as a little girl anymore, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madison walks off, calls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't send it to him as a jpeg, though. He'll put it up on his fantasy football web-site. And  then your brother sees it, tells  your mom, and suddenly you're not  allowed to use Facebook for a  month. Thanks, Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves Jessica there, processing the advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica EXITS the school, lost in thought. There's a bit of commotion outside. TEENAGERS are pointing and LAUGHING at something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica pushes through and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE, standing atop a man-made, tall, wooden  platform/scaffold in front of the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he RIPS OPEN his button-up shirt, revealing a SCARLET  J taped to his pale, hairless chest. He has recreated the famous Scarlet Letter tableau. He pulls out a piece of paper, reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathaniel Hawthorne wrote in The Scarlet Letter: `No man for any considerable period can wear one face to himself and another to the multitude, without finally getting bewildered as to which may be the true.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie puts down the paper, ignoring the jeers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not bewildered! Jessica Riley is my soulmate. She's the  one! I know it to be true, and so  now do the multitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Multitudes? (then, deciding) No, multitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie, get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have marked myself with this Scarlet J, Jessica! For you. Because your name starts with a J. It's just tape and construction paper but one day I will get a permanent tattoo when I'm old enough that my parents won't freak out on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie Weaver! I am your baby- sitter and I'm telling you to GET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does the trick. He gets down to mocking APPLAUSE. Jessica pulls him off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like the scaffold? It has wheels. Took four weeks to build it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, those are my friends, they helped me wheel it down. Wave hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF TO THE SIDE: Three excited THIRTEEN-YEAR-OLDS WAVE and give THUMBS-UPS to Robbie. Jessica waves, confused, turns back to Robbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has to stop, Robbie. Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll learn to love me. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because I'm four years younger than you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stops Robbie dead in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been spending time with him for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie stumbles, less sure-footed than usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You can't. I've checked. No boyfriend since ninth grade. No date for Spring Formal last

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's older. I don't want my parents to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Robbie literally just sits down on the ground, all the wind taken out of him. It might be the cutest thing you've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know him? Is he from town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Yes, kind of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill him if he hurts you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica tries not to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But this all has to stop now, Robbie. The speeches, the texts, all of it. It's very sweet, but it has to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just sits there, lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you around, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She EXITS. Robbie remains seated on the grass. Devastated. His three friends approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should probably get the scaffold back on the road before dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie's on the couch, dejected. His little sister sits  next to him, watching High School Musical as always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the adjoining kitchen, Cal is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nanna! I know, it's been forever. Have you been getting out at all? I'll bring you some of that deli you like one night, okay? The kids? They're fine. (to other room) Kids, say hi to Nanna.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE AND MOLLY
dialogues.text: Hi, Nanna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I've been keeping busy. Made  a new buddy, I've been spending time with him. Yeah, I'm going to  see her tomorrow night. Of course  I miss her. You don't know how much I miss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice cracks. He turns, sees Robbie staring. He heads into the bathroom with the phone, closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie SIGHS, turns back to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal and Robbie are having a catch. Robbie is listless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're seeing Mom tomorrow, huh? At my parent-teacher thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but no biggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal tosses him back the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's with the moping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's just... there's  this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? You like her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Pringles. This girl's my  soulmate. I'm like crazy, stupid,  in love with her. And she wants  someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's your soulmate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can't just give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? (then, quietly) You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom was yours, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Dad. I love you. I have your back, always. But let's be honest here: the woman told you she wanted a divorce and you jumped out of a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was slightly more complicated than that. And I'm a different guy now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the same guy. You just have different clothes. Do you  still love her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old ARE you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still love Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal doesn't say anything. His silence speaks volumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't we talking about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are. Your son is in desperate need of some romantic inspiration. So set an example for your boy.  Don't give up. It's complicated? Uncomplicate it. She says no? Change her mind. Look at you, you're the man right now, Dad. Get her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie punctuates his pep talk by tossing Cal the ball, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal is lost in thought. The ball sails past him and THROUGH THE WINDOW of a nearby car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARENTS walk hand-in-hand, into the school. It's Parent-  Teacher conference night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal sits on a small chair outside a classroom. Tracy  approaches.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal looks up. Tracy stands there. She's dressed down, but looks amazing. Vulnerable and nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look great, Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well turns out I've been buying the wrong size suit for twenty years so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you look great. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always look great, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward. Neither knows what to say now. Tracy takes the  seat next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to Nanna yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. She sound okay to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sounded like... Nanna. She  worries about us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy NODS. A long beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I'm about to get detention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy LAUGHS, tension broken a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which teacher is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Thompson. This is the one he pulled The Scarlet Letter Asshole routine on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a really weird kid, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of like him, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, too. I'm so glad we switched the babies at the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH. God, these two are great together when they're in rhythm. The laughter trickles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how are things with... (a beat, then) How's it going with David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't about him, if that means  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal looks at his watch, a nervous gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seeing anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, me? No. You know me. No, not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Because you hear things, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another long beat of silence. Cal gathers himself, takes a breath, and turns toward Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you, T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy looks up surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got complacent, I think. You find your soulmate in high  school... you've got the game  sewed up in the first quarter, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put in an effort when we were younger, didn't I? I'd do anything to make you happy: take you miniature golfing, dancing -- you were such a good dancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to be. You were such a good miniature golfer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, emboldened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I ever wanted to do was make you love me. And then you did, really early on. And we got married so young. And I guess... I got lazy. I got boring. And I'm furious at you for what you did. But I don't totally blame you, if that makes any sense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have jumped out of the car. I should have fought for you. You fight for your soulmate. At least that's what our thirteen- year-old tells me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy's eyes well up with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a very strange boy, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be honest: he scares the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She LAUGHS through her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal takes her hand, kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Weaver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Robbie's English teacher, Mrs. Thompson... better known to us as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE (the teacher from the bar who Cal slept with).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal freezes, his lips on Tracy's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking to the sky) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, yes... we've met before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've met before? Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Thompson? This is my wife. Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so now she's your WIFE again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate's getting louder now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we head inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She STORMS INSIDE. Tracy looks at Cal, follows her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate PACES in front of the classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm playing catch-up: how do you two know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe your husband should tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a mutual friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, maybe we should focus on Robbie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, let's do that. Let's focus on Robbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate goes to her blackboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know, Robbie's shining moment this year was when he set a school record for cursing in an eighth grade English class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She writes on the board: ASSHOLE. She underlines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole. Are you familiar with this word, Mrs. Weaver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's heard it, yes. So in terms of Robbie's progress --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole: as in, someone who tells a woman that he'll call, and never does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were a little concerned about Robbie's grade on his oral book

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole: as in, someone who uses `honesty' to get a woman into bed with him, but is actually full of shit like the rest of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because usually he's a very strong public speaker --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole: as in, someone who allows a woman to go down on him for forty-five minutes because he's `nervous' --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stops. Cal turns to Tracy. She looks crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy rushes out of the room. Cal calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's an alcoholic! You can't trust what she says!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE SCREAMS in horror. Cal races after Tracy. Kate races after Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A three-way chase:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone, Cal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sober for FIVE YEARS, you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEACHERS and PARENTS (including Jessica's parents), stepping out into the hallway and following them outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy races to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, c'mon! We were separated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fumbling for keys) I know, and I cheated, so it doesn't make any sense for me to be mad at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this now, Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her she's the perfect combination of sexy and cute,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy looks at Cal, stunned. That's their thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a funny story, actually --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, wait! Yes, I slept with her! I slept with our son's eighth grade teacher!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASPS from the crowd. Claire (Jessica's Mom) takes a picture with her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But all it did was confirm what I already knew: THAT I LOVE, YOU!

dialogues.speaker: I LOVE YOU
dialogues.text: Tracy hesitates. Cal seizes the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before, you were the only woman I'd ever been with or wanted to be with. And now, even after I've been with eleven women, you're STILL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He instantly trails off, realizing. MORE GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the only woman I want to be with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy gets in her car and speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly, to himself) I'm your soulmate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal turns around to the crowd, only to be met...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By a SLAP ACROSS the face by Kate. She STORMS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER CRACKS in the sky. It begins to pour. Cal stands there, soaked. He looks up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the rain pours down as DINERS scurry into the  restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been here before... the same group of BORING PEOPLE at the same table. Liz and Hannah CHAT off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a cake on the table that says "CONGRATS HANNAH!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard stands on a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, everyone. Everyone!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room goes quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if we could get our guest of honor over here... I forget what she looks like, anyone remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLITE LAUGHS. Liz GAGS herself with her finger, looks at Hannah. Hannah takes a deep breath, downs her drink, and walks over to Richard. Is this it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so proud of you, baby. I had my doubts, of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More CHEESY LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I did tell you that it'd be a special night when you passed the bar. And I'm a lawyer so you know I never lie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More HECKLING from the crowd. Liz desperately orders another drink, barely able to take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Hannah, I'd like to formally ask you, in front of all our friends and colleagues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah waits, frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... if you'd like to become a permanent lawyer at the firm of Watkins, Goldberg, and Schmidt!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHEERS. Hannah steps back, breathless. Richard reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a better offer already, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's great. I just... (then, privately) I'm sorry, I thought... I thought you were about to propose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room goes quiet, trying to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just... it's fine. I'm sorry, I just got thrown is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard pulls Hannah off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm so sorry, I didn't realize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, don't be silly, it's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's definitely a possibility, down the road. I think I just need a little more time. I'm still figuring out how I feel about us, you know: long-term.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- you're figuring out how you feel about us? She LAUGHS. Once. Then twice. Loudly. Everyone's now watching. Liz gets a good seat, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's really laughing now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what the best part is: I would have said yes! To YOU! And I didn't even want you to propose! Just now, I swear to God: I was hoping you wouldn't propose. And I still would have said YES! That's how pathetic I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snags someone else's drink from the table, DOWNS IT. She grabs Richard's cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will consider your job offer, thank you so much, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hysterically LAUGHING, she walks away. As she passes, Liz sticks out her hand and they slap five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Jacob sits alone in the bar. He checks his watch. No Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, he looks very alone at his usual table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes it off, stands, and approaches the table of a group of nearby WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them is telling a story:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what she said?

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What? What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing there, in all his glory. He flashes his coolest smile. They melt. We've seen this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM! The door to the bar busts open, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dripping wet from the rain, looking almost wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scans the room, quickly, searching for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots him, marches straight to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time, he looks like a deer in the  headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs him. Kisses him. A long, deep, almost angry kiss. She pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still think I'm attractive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still want to take me home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah NODS, takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads him out of the bar. We STAY WITH the WOMEN Jacob had just been introducing himself to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't been here yet. It's exactly what you'd expect though: an elegant bachelor-pad. Modern furniture. Sleek. Everything just right. Jacob puts an album on  his record player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place looks like something out of a men's magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a compliment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music starts playing: "As Tears Go By" by the Stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob pours two nice glasses of SCOTCH, neat. Brings them (and the bottle) over towards the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pats the couch. Hannah nods, walks over, sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They CLINK. Jacob takes a sip. Hannah downs hers. She  holds out her glass for a refill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob raises a brow, pours her another. This time she HOLDS HER NOSE as she downs it. As soon as she finishes choking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is this how it normally works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you woo a woman? You take them back to your granite- countered bachelor pad, put on the perfect song, and make them a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. That's how it normally works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah NODS, grabs the bottle, takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then you sleep with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's what happens next? We sleep together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At some point, yes, I was under the impression that was your plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a deep breath, admits:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know at the bar I seemed confident, but I was more just soaking wet and cold and trying to be dramatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob LAUGHS. He actually LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're adorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah SNAPS, already tipsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Not adorable! Sexy! R-rated sexy! Because I know what happens next in the PG-13 version of tonight: I get really drunk, and I pass out, and you cover me with a blanket, and kiss my forehead, and nothing happens... but that's not why I'm here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to bang the hot guy from the bar who hit on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think people say `bang' anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. We're going to bang. I'm finally going to do something exciting and dangerous and Liz can blow me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah shakes her hands out, pumping herself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, this is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to stop thinking. Take off your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob SHRUGS, stands, unbuttons his shirt and takes it off. He's ripped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pokes a finger at his abs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like you're photo-shopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now take off yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! Not with all that happening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She motions casually at his abs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... do you prefer to do it here or in the bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bedroom is preferable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah stands, a girl on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Let's go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile Cal, beaten up and soaking wet from the rain, ENTERS. He looks to his usual table, in need of a friend's company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jacob isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah lies on her back in the dim light. Jacob is on top of her, shirtless. They're making out, gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This pillow is amazing. It forms perfectly to the shape of my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They resume kissing. After a beat, she pulls back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, are these those foam pillows from Brookstone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off his look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are, aren't they!? I always wondered who actually buys them! You do! The hot guy from the bar buys them! Of course!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, amazed. Gathers herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, let's proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob smiles, goes to kiss her... she pulls back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have one of those ridiculous massage chairs, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. My. God! You totally do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She STARTS LAUGHING HYSTERICALLY. It's infectious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much did it cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thousand doll--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That DOUBLES HER OVER, hysterical. Jacob starts laughing with her... really laughing. We can tell: this is different for him. He likes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch him as he realizes that. As he processes it. We watch him look at Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hair in her face: drunk, laughing, completely amazing. And then... Jacob does the most unexpected thing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor. Ask me a question about myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No! I don't want to know anything about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, one question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine, but then we bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Now, come on, I'll answer anything. You can ask me about my job, or past

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your mom like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question takes him by surprise. He hesitates, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Icy... I guess? Not cruel, but cold. Very cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He died, long time ago. Left us a lot of money, which is how I have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions at his PILLOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She motions at his abs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And time for stuff like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad was the opposite of my mom, actually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK as they continue chatting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME PASSES, as one question leads to another, and then another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Body language shifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Soon they're sitting in bed, sharing the Scotch from the bottle, just talking. Then kissing. Then lying on their sides, face-to-face, talking some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Until finally: it's Jacob who passes out. And it's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah who covers him with a blanket, and kisses him on the forehead, and begins falling in love with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUE MUSIC as we begin a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah looks longingly at Jacob's plate of pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices, switches plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. He smiles. God, he's crazy about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the next table, watches a LOVELORN GUY switch plates with his GIRLFRIEND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY DOWN the row, HANDS are held between COUPLES, all  entranced by the movie, until we REVEAL:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: staring down at his hand, locked with Hannah's. He looks  terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's Hannah who's asleep in bed, and Jacob who stares at her lovingly. Suddenly, he catches himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a series of COMEDIC JUMP-CUTS, he wrestles with the  implications of what's happening to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Pacing. A drink. A big drink. Fingers pulling at  his own hair. Hyperventilating. More staring. More  pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally, he loses the battle: he tucks Hannah under  a blanket, kisses her forehead, and finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gives in to falling in love with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal is sitting at the table that once belonged to Jacob.  He suddenly seems very alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks towards the bar, notices that same SAD SACK  MIDDLE-AGED GUY. Also alone. He picks up his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy sits at a table, FLOWERS off to the side. Her  phone rings. She looks at it, sees it's "Cal." She hits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal DAVID JACOBWITZ, across from her. He  looks at Tracy and smiles. She smiles back weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The awkward end of a first date. David walks Tracy to  the front door. She's carrying those same flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had fun tonight, Tracy. And I  was wondering if --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, stop. Look, I had a nice  time, which is a substantial  upgrade from the rest of the...  times I've been having lately.  So, I don't think I'm ready to  start dating but my ex clearly is  and there's a yogurt shop where  they make this eight calorie ice  cream that tastes like a laxative,  so if you'd like to take me there  sometime I guess I wouldn't say  no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You know, that's exactly  what I was thinking. It's almost  uncanny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH. This is the moment. Romantic chemistry.  Are they going to kiss? Holy cow. And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOOR OPENS. Jessica stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jessica. Hi. Sorry.  Jessica, this is my work-friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an accountant named David.  David, this is my baby-sitter,  Jessica. Okay, David, well  everything sounds great.  Spreadsheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David smiles knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He EXITS. Tracy stands there with Jessica, awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie sneaks down the stairs. From a kneeling position,  he can hear and see everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... How was dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pretty dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy reaches for her purse, awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how much do I owe yo--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know your kids are the  only ones I baby-sit for who  always want to stay awake so they  can see their dad when he gets  home. I mean, they fight with  everything they have to keep their  eyes open so they can hear what  Dad had for dinner, or how he  liked the movie. Lot of kids want  to stay awake for Mom -- and your  kids always want to see you, don't  get me wrong -- but not a lot wait  up for Dad. Maybe it's because  he's good, and he's kind, and he's  decent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking abo--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batshit crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks out the door. Tracy looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica turns, explodes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's gone. Tracy SIGHS ("what the hell was that")  and CLOSES the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy locks the door and leans against it... processing  what Jessica just said about Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the FLOWERS down on the table, and heads into  the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at top of the stairs, regarding the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUE MUSIC. Robbie rides his bike down the street. He's  got Tracy's FLOWERS nestled in his handlebars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica ENTERS in a huff, goes right toward a drawer in  her dresser. She pulls out a CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we watch as she: Sets it on her dresser. Hits the  timer. Steps back. Drops her clothes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prints a PHOTO from her camera. And places it in an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Cal Weaver." With a heart. She stares at the envelope  for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then: HER DOORBELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica jumps, started. She quickly puts the envelope in  a drawer and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the front door. Sitting on her stoop:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same flowers that David Jacobowitz gave Tracy sit out front. She looks at the note. It reads: "Just give me  a chance, love David J" but the "David J." has been  crossed out and replaced with "Robbie."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, takes the flowers, closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES as we spy the Weaver family through their windows: Robbie plays video games in his room. Molly  watching her show in hers. Tracy in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE DOWN the house, and OUTSIDE, where we discover:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal in stealth mode, tending to his backyard. He  fertilizes, trims and waters. All under cover of night.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Kids! Ice cream!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal looks into the living room. Tracy has brought out  ice cream: a carton with three spoons. The kids race  down the stairs, join her, and start eating. Laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take in the real-time TABLEAU:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal's wife and children -- his family -- inside. Cal:  watching them from the outside, looking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's touching. It's complicated. It's horribly painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE... Tracy looks at her kids, thinks of something.  She steps into the KITCHEN, closes the door, and DIALS  her phone. Cal leans toward the window, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSIDE... Cal's phone rings. He jumps to silence it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Cal is looking at her inside. She has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... I'm in the basement. I'm  trying to get the water heater  working `cause the pilot's out and  I don't know how to relight it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously Cal sees she's not in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to bother you, I just...  what do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal lowers the phone, looks at her, hesitates. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine, it's fine. I'm glad  you called. Here: I'll walk you  through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see the little grey door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pantomimes this in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it's down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you see the red button? I  wrote `push' on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push. Now turn that to the right  and stick the match in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there it goes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now just close the door and  you're good to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The charade is over. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks, Cal. I...  appreciate your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, anytime. Call anytime with  stuff like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to you later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And... thanks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal HANGS up. He takes one final look back at his wife  as the sprinklers go off in the backyard and douse him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal sits on his little couch, between Robbie and Molly. Molly is once again absorbed in High School Musical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal looks depressed. Robbie doesn't look much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanna's coming over tonight. You guys haven't seen her in a while. Wanna stay for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom's working till five,  we'll have to tell her. (off their silence)  What do you guys want to do today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) High School Musical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's a shocker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes back into her trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She still won't talk to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if that show's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Just hellos and goodbyes when we pass you guys off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond your pay-grade, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal looks pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will say this though: I got close. We were laughing. Talking about old times, all the things we used to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes drift to the TV. It's the timeless GOLF SCENE  from High School Musical II. A LIGHT BULB goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Get your coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie smiles, runs off. Cal turns to Molly, REMOTE in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby? I'm gonna have to turn off the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm turning it off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just does it! He turns the TV off. Silence. Molly turns towards him, stares. A long, scary, beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (free at last) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal KISSES her, jumps up from the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal talks to a SALESMAN. Robbie and Molly bounce around, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal talks to a different SALESMAN. Robbie and Molly extend a MEASURING TAPE across the ground, assisting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal rents a TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal picks up materials. As he rounds a corner, he runs  into... BERNIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how've you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie: I'd love to catch up, but  I'm doing something at the old  house tonight and I'm in a bit of  a rush so... yeah. Thanks again  for the cologne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly points out her three favorite DAY LABORERS, Cal hires them. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kind of construction is going on back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal's cell phone RINGS. We go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with JACOB on his. He's waiting outside a LIQUOR STORE in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. My. God. It's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I know I've been out  of circulation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You abandoned me at my time of  need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been a little... things have  gotten a bit... I met a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean, I've been spending a lot of time with her. This woman. One woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, tonight... I'm going to  meet her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!!!! Look at you! You do realize you might actually have to answer a question or two about yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I realize that, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah comes out of the wine store, hops over the car. Jacob can't help but smile: wow, he's REALLY into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go. Grab a beer next week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got my number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Good for you, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal HANGS up, LAUGHS to himself, and gets back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy pulls up to her house. As she pulls in she notices  Robbie. He's standing outside the front door in a  tuxedo... a shit-eating grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SIGHS ("what now?") and parks the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile. Claire is putting away laundry. She throws  some underwear in Jessica's bottom drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Notices something. An envelope. It's addressed to Cal Weaver. Curiosity piqued, she picks it up. Looks inside. Almost faints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Bernie sits in a recliner, watching football and  drinking a cold one. Jessica lies on the floor, doing  homework.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire ENTERS, ashen. Zombie-like, she hands Bernie the envelope. Jessica looks up, sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps, but it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring at the picture. We don't see it, but we get the point: it's a father's worst nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie, dazed, slides the pictures back into the envelope. He looks at the envelope again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal's name. A heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie puts a hand up. He can't speak. He marches out the door. From inside we hear a car SCREECH AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realizing. She grabs a second set of keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica runs into a second car. Races after her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile. Tracy approaches Robbie. Not only is he  wearing a tuxedo, he's carrying a bunch of SCARVES.  Tracy LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby! What are you wearing!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy's face drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to blindfold you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? What is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Mom. He's your husband, not Al Queda. You'll make it out alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't help but smile. She kneels down, allowing Robbie to BLINDFOLD HER from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ties a SCARF around her eyes. Then ANOTHER at a different angle, double-knots it. Then ANOTHER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we're good, let's do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile. There's no expression on Bernie's face. It's frightening. He looks down at passenger seat. At the ENVELOPE bearing Cal's address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He RACES through a light. A HORN blares behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica is the one BLARING THE HORN, crying and panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She too RACES through the same light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie leads a blindfolded Tracy into the backyard. She  looks like a zombie with all the scarves over her face. We see what she is not yet privy to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal's Shangri-La has been transformed: the yard holds a  FULL-BLOWN MINIATURE GOLF HOLE, windmill and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal stands behind it all, in a tux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take these off, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost. Kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie CUES music (which will play throughout this  scene). Molly, in a PARTY DRESS, carries a glass of  champagne to Tracy and puts it in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five years ago, Cal Weaver  saw Tracy Boyle for the first  time, walking the halls of  Woodside Middle School --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal: are you seriously doing this  in front of the kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it goes bad I'm supposed to  take Molly upstairs and put the TV  on loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy SIGHS, giving up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, might as well wait for your  daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right next to you, T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, your other daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Just then:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside the house steps out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WTF! And right behind her... JACOB. Holding a bottle of  wine and smiling like an idiot. Everyone freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, you two know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Nanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Robbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, cutie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, I couldn't pronounce Hannah when I was little -- wait, so how do you know my dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, this is my boyfriend, Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. No. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the boyfriend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can someone please take this off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you two, like, really know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way -- you and her... no way. End it, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's not going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then I'm going to murder you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (down to two scarves) Will someone please take this goddamn thing off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie, take the goddamn thing off your mother! (then, looking up)  Bernie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM! A body flies into Cal and knocks him OUT OF FRAME.  It's Bernie! Behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSICA runs after her father, SCREAMING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Jessica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! Bernie lands a solid right into Cal's jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie is pummeling Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob dives in. Tries to pull Bernie off. Bernie NAILS Jacob with an UPPERCUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie, I DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU'RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie picks up a WINDMILL from the miniature GOLF COURSE, readies to bash it over Cal's head. Jessica throws herself on Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This breaks Bernie's trance. He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't do anything. He doesn't even know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie, please get this off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling with it) I'm TRYING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't even know that I'm in love with him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie stops, turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at Cal) With him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you pointing at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you pointing at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she pointing at!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait: my dad is the older guy you've been seeing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets ready to pummel some more. Jessica grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't even know about the dirty pictures I made for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made him dirty pictures? Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie looks to Cal. He's angry, jealous, and broken-  hearted all at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one? You're the one  she...  (then, furious)  You stole my soulmate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait: Jessica is your soulmate?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, is Tracy home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns: DAVID JACOBOWITZ stands in the doorway.  He's holding up a SWEATER in his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left your sweater in my car  the other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Jacobowitz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Jacobowitz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Jacobowitz!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a bad time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK!!! Jacob LEVELS David Jacobowitz with a right  hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how much misery you've put this poor bastard through!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Jacob can finish, Cal LEVELS Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay the hell away from my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob JUMPS on Cal. David jumps on Jacob. Bernie tries to pull them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica finally gets the blindfold off Tracy. The women and children watch the battle in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal, Jacob, Bernie, and David Jacobowitz sit side-by-side on the miniature golf hole, bloodied but still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: TWO POLICE OFFICERS standing in the center of the yard. One of them finishes writing in a pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, okay. That should about do it. (to his partner)  What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other cop SHRUGS. The first cop, thinks, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm just gonna write domestic disturbance reported but all clear, okay? `Cause honestly, I don't even know what to put down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods, walks to the door. Stops there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just... simmer down, okay? We all have arguments, but if you're gonna fight -- just do it inside.  Keep it in the family, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob SNARFS down a laugh. Cal glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops look at Cal, at each other, SHRUG, and EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward silence. Our whole cast is there: disheveled and bloodied. The place looks like a hurricane has hit.  A miniature golf hole torn to shreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie turns to Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She NODS. Looks back at Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's that. Robbie runs to the driveway, looks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jessica runs after her father, trying to apologize. But he won't even look at her. They get in their respective cars, drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob approaches Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal turns to Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man is a lowlife and a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath)  Oh, that's ironic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal whips around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy doesn't push it. Cal turns back to Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may not be able to see it, but  I have. Over and over again. You are not to see him any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, c'mon, I'm not going to stop seeing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then I don't have anything  else to say to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal, stop being unreasona--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said: GET THE HELL OUT OF MY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time it's Tracy whose face registers shock. Hannah takes Jacob's hand, pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (one last try) Cal, c'mon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Cal won't even look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Nanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, cutie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They EXIT. Cal lets them go, then grabs his things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's all yours, David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he goes, Cal stops in front of Robbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go big or go home, right, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie looks up at him, cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal NODS, EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUE: John Mayer's "Who Says."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) ROBBIE, at school. His spirit is crushed. He looks  at his CONTACT LIST, thinks, and DELETES JESSICA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2) at home, grounded and sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3) trying to get HANNAH to make a phone call to her father... she won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4) at her office, finally taking down the picture of her  and Cal. And speaking of Cal...  110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal sits back at his usual table. This isn't "Cool Cal," the Jacob disciple. No, this is "Sad Mess Cal." He's  grown a patchy beard. He's wearing a ratty sweatsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's drinking, once again, vodka-cranberry out of a wimpy red straw. It's pathetic. A WAITRESS APPROACHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2:30. In the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2:30 would have been sufficient but I appreciate the judgment, Cocktail Waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, another drink would be grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal feels bad for that one. As she re-approaches:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was uncalled for. Sorry for being a dick.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ah, it's okay, I deserved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing there. As always, he looks perfectly put together. He takes in Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a nice sweatsuit, Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, are we going to be mature about this, or act like children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Are we going to be mature or act like children?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so like children then. Move over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob SLIDES in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still seeing my daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I have nothing to say to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal, look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal looks. Jacob still has that power over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been hanging out here a lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be missing a lot of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a lot of vacation days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate the beach... you've got a  lot of nerve coming here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, the WAITRESS re-approaches. Delivers Cal's drink. They wait her out. She EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a sip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she probably spit in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob NODS as Cal pushes the drink away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your kids miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hanging out with my kids, fantastic! You can teach Robbie how to objectify women, he'll love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eighth grade graduation is  next week. You coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you haven't exactly been around for him, Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not my biggest fan right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's a good excuse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, man-whore, if your lecture on parental responsibility is almost done --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love her, Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been in love before.  Honestly, I've never even been in  `like' before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never got it. I saw people in  love -- I saw weakness. I heard them say the things they said, and do the things they do, it all just seemed so... so pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my perfect combination of everything, Cal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cal looks up at Jacob. He smiles, gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you. I know what you are.  You are not good enough for my  daughter. And you will never have  my permission nor my approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you at graduation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He EXITS. Once more, Cal is alone. Just as he wants it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small MIDDLE-SCHOOL AMPHITHEATER. About 150 people  fill the crowd of an intimate middle school graduation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, Molly, and Hannah sit in the front row. Jessica  sits with her family a few rows away. All look nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sits Cal, sandwiched between RANDOM SPECTATORS. Cal is  now shaven and well-dressed but he looks miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes brighten for a moment as he notices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN EMPTY SEAT between Tracy and Hannah. He leans  forward, are they saving it for him? But just then...  Jacob arrives. Kisses Hannah and takes "Cal's" seat.  Cal looks nauseous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We WATCH the ceremony for a moment. The PRINCIPAL labors  through her introduction...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
